channel.title: How do i add this?
channel.description:
1.How do i find the Item Id In Dclaws.
2.How do i add wild zone? Make a code and put on here but put #### for every coord part ok? that way i can edit it.
3.How do i add a funpk? Give me a working code please.
4.How Do i Edit shop prices?
5.What are the coords for The underground thing at the champions guild.
Msn:Coder_Fatality@hotmail.com Contact me! Sorry for posting so much I just needed help with my server.
Thanks, Coder Fatality.
Might need Help later!

item.title: How do i add this?
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

  1. Check the modeling section of the forums, or use the search bar.

  2. If you are using a 317 server, Go into your client.java file and hit ctrl + f.

Then type in

public boolean nonWild

Then when you see

|| (absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY<= ####)

You are in the right section. You then have to add in your own coordinates on what you want to be a safe zone.

Pretty much what

 absX >= #### && absX <= ####

is saying is that any X value between the two numbers is safe.

Ex:

 absX >= 3493 && absX <= 3500

^ That means that any X-value between the value of 3493 and 3500 will be safe. Then you need to put in your Y-values so that you don’t just have a strip going across your map that is safe. So in fact, you are basically making a box for your safe area.

                       [v absY <= ####]
                       --------X---------
                       |                       |
                       |                       |

[absX >= #### >] X X [< absX <= ####]
| |
| |
--------X---------
[^ absY >= ####]

I hope my drawing makes it easy for you to understand it. =/

If you want to make a wild area, forget about everything that I just said, and just put up items around what you want to be the wild area.

Client.java

Ctrl + f

public void NewObjects

  1. Just make it so that if anyone dies within a certain area, they keep their items on death and they don’t drop anything.

  2. items.cfg

  3. Search around on google for it. If you still cannot find it, send me a message. My MSN is rudy281221@yahoo.com.

Read full topic
